abstract: Microsoft is not letting people choose usernames with the word “Tibet” in them when signing up for its online services. But it has an explanation — and it’s not political.
snippet: Microsoft is not letting people choose usernames with the word “Tibet” in them when signing up for its online services. But it has an explanation — and it’s not political.
lead_paragraph: A reader wrote in to say he had heard that Microsoft was not letting people choose usernames with the word “Tibet” in them when signing up for its online services. This turns out to be true, technically speaking. If you try to select such a name you get an error message:

headline.main: Rumor Control: Why I Can’t Put ‘Tibet’ in My Hotmail Address
